home.welcome: Welcome to the official website of the International Commission Against Corruption and Organised Crime. We are a non-governmental, non-profit organization headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.

about.title: About the Commission
about.vision: Global leadership in combating corruption and organized crime.
about.mission: Human societies free of corruption and organized crime.
about.values: Transparency, humanity, universality, quality, and professionalism.
goals: Contribute to international efforts to combat corruption and organized crime, and to devise effective preventive measures.
Advocate for implementing international mechanisms, plans and programs to fight corruption and organized crime, especially the UN Convention against Corruption.
Raise awareness of the risks and societal impacts of corruption.
Encourage and support civil society organizations to actively contribute to anti-corruption efforts.
Conduct legal studies to assess and review relevant domestic and international legislation and its effectiveness and alignment with desired goals.
Urge countries lacking anti-corruption legislation to enact it, and provide technical advice when needed.
Contribute to following up corruption cases and submitting files for study to competent authorities at national and international levels.
Implement capacity-building programs for specialized bodies, civil society organizations and stakeholders.
Promote the value of integrity as a moral principle and raise awareness of corruption risks.
Provide technical assistance and advice for implementing international decisions (e.g., asset recovery) in coordination with relevant actors.
Provide technical assistance regarding the measures required to implement international decisions related to corruption, in coordination with competent authorities.

who.title: Who we are
body: The International Commission Against Corruption and Organised Crime is an independent, non-governmental and non-profit organization based in Geneva. It focuses on issues that significantly affect people’s lives, notably corruption and organized crime.
We cooperate with entities and individuals who share our objectives and are willing to contribute to the fight against these crimes.
Established in the heart of Europe, next to the UN’s Geneva office, the Commission contributes to international peace and security, supports law-enforcement efforts and empowers civil society.

items.text: Organizing and participating in seminars, conferences, and workshops on combating corruption and organized crime.
Forming local and international teams to develop and improve relevant laws and regulations.
Establishing partnerships and cooperation agreements with competent entities.
Signing memoranda of understanding with international institutions.
Cooperating with universities and civil-society organizations in training and awareness programs.
Receiving reports and referring them for verification and follow-up with the relevant authorities.
Running public awareness campaigns through media channels.
Leveraging international occasions to promote integrity and transparency.
Strengthening community partnerships among all stakeholders in anti-corruption efforts.

activities.title: What we do
items: Hold and take part in seminars, conferences and workshops on combating corruption and organized crime at local, regional and international levels.
Form local and international teams to amend and develop legislation.
Conclude partnerships, understandings and agreements with relevant bodies.
Sign memoranda of understanding with international institutions.
Cooperate with universities and civil-society organizations to deliver educational, training and awareness programs.
Receive reports and complaints on corruption and organized crime, refer them for verification and follow up with competent bodies.
Work with media outlets to run public awareness campaigns.
Leverage international occasions, such as the UN’s International Anti-Corruption Day, to promote integrity.
Encourage cross-stakeholder collaboration and strengthen community partnerships.
Promote and participate in international anti-corruption awards.
